doc:
Larry Roberts (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_Roberts_(actor) 0 Larry Roberts (September 28, 1926 – July 17, 1992) was an American actor, voice actor and comedian who was most active in the 1950s. Although he was well known for his roles in the 1950s TV series Lights, Camera, Action!, Roberts is probably best known for his role of playing the voice of Tramp in the 1955 movie Lady and the Tramp. Roberts was little known for other roles, although he did play some minor uncredited roles in Bandstand Revue and Ace High-Hits. Roberts, though inactive in his later years, would continue to play movie roles until his later years. He died of AIDS in 1992 at the age of 65. Larry_Roberts ( September_28_,_1926 – July_17_,_1992 ) was an_American_actor , voice_actor and comedian who was most_active in the_1950s . Although he was_well_known for his_roles in the_1950s_TV_series_Lights_,_Camera_,_Action ! , Roberts is_probably_best_known for his_role of playing the_voice of Tramp in the_1955_movie_Lady and the_Tramp . Roberts was little_known for other_roles , although he did_play some_minor_uncredited_roles in Bandstand_Revue and Ace_High-Hits . Roberts , though inactive in his_later_years , would_continue_to_play movie_roles until his_later_years . He died of AIDS in 1992 at the_age of 65 .
